To compute f■g, we need to find the partial derivatives of f and g with respect to x, and then add them:

\begin{align*}\frac{\partial f}{\partial x} &= \frac{\partial}{\partial x} (sinx) + \frac{\partial}{ \partial x} (y^2) \\

&= cosx + 2y \frac{\partial y}{\partial f} \frac{\partial f}{\partial x} \end{align*}

& = -sinx - y \frac{\partial y}{\partial g} \frac{\partial g}{\partial x}\end{align*}

Now we can evaluate the partial derivatives of g with respect to x:

&= -sinx\end{align*}
